page.title: 16ENTERTAINMENT NORTHOP BAND
page.content: Clwyd can be well proud of its musical tradition, it playing an important part in the social and cultural life of many villages.All school children have the opportunity if they so wish to learn to play a musical instrument. Such is the interest of many young people that they like to continue with this activity out of school.Northop Silver Band relies heavily on the participation of young local pupils. The band was first formed in 1911 in the Cross Keys Public House in Sychdyn. Today, the band practises in the Northop Cricket ground, every Tuesday and Friday (6-7.30p.m.)The band is conducted by a Mr D Thelwell and the band includes 6 cornets,3 horns,2 tubas,3 trombones,1 euphonium and 1 set of drums. The band is well known in musical circles both in and out of Wales.
